Mike Pence , R-Ind., who is a favorite of fiscal and social conservatives but rejected appeals that he run for president, turned down an invitation to speak at CPAC, where he has appeared six times. At this time, the congressman is focusing his attention on Indiana, Mike Pence spokesman Matt Lloyd said. "He hopes to participate in future CPAC opportunities as his schedule permits."
